    <dl>
           <dt>bha 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bha</em> aspirate of <em>ba</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhak&#x0101;ra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;k&#x0101;ra</em> m. the letter or sound <em>bha</em></dd>

           <dt>bha 2</dt>
           <dd><em>bha</em> (in gram.) N. of the weakest base of nouns (as opp. to <em>pada</em> and <em>a&#x1e45;ga</em>, q.v.) i.e. of the base before the vowel terminations except in strong cases, before feminine suffixes, and before Taddhitas beginning with vowels or <em>y</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 1-4, 18 &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>bha 3</dt>
           <dd><em>bha</em> (in prosody) a dactyl</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhavipul&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;vipul&#x0101;</em> f. N. of a metre <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pi&#x1e45;g">Pi&#x1e45;g.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a></dd>

           <dt>bha 4</dt>
           <dd><em>bha</em> (&#x221a;1. <em>bh&#x0101;</em>), m. N. of the planet Venus or its regent, (= <em>&#x015b;ukra</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; semblance, delusion, error <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>), f. light or a beam of light, lustre, splendour <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> &amp;c. (cf. 2. <em>bh&#x0101;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the shadow of a gnomon <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; appearance, resemblance, likeness (ifc </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>agni-bha</em>, <em>gu&#x1e0d;a-bh&#x0101;</em>, <em>tantubha</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a star, planet, asterism, lunar asterism or mansion (and so also the number 27 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>nak&#x1e63;atra</em>), sign of the zodiac <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;S">G&#x1e5b;S.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;atr">&#x015a;atr.</a> &amp;c</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhakak&#x1e63;&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kak&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em> f. the path of the asterisms <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhaga&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;ga&#x1e47;a</em> m. = <em>-cakra</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; = next <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhagama </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;gama</em> m. the revolution of a planet <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hcat">Hcat.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhagola </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;gola</em> m. the starry sphere, vault of heaven <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhacakra </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;cakra</em> n. the whole multitude of stars or asterisms <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-n&#x0101;bhi</em> f. the centre of the zodiac <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MW">MW.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhadatta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;datta</em> m. N. of an astronomer <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> (v&#x1e37;. <em>badanta</em>, q.v.)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhapa </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pa</em> mfn. the regent of an asterism <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhapa&#x00f1;jara </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pa&#x00f1;jara</em> m. 'cage of asterism', the firmament <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;ryabh">&#x0100;ryabh.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhapati </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pati</em> m. lord of asterism, the moon <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhapra&#x015b;asta </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;pra&#x015b;asta</em> mfn. favourable in regard to the asterism <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;">&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;khG&#x1e5b;.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhabhrama </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bhrama</em> m. 'star-revolution', a sidereal day <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ga&#x1e47;it">Ga&#x1e47;it.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhama&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhayuj </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;yuj</em> mfn. connected with or present in a lunar mansion <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Jyot">Jyot.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;sa&#x1e43;dhi</em> m. 'point of junction of the a&#x1e6d;asterism', N. of the last quarters of the asterism &#x0100;&#x015b;lesha, Jyesh&#x1e6d;h&#x0101;, and Revat&#x012b;</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhasam&#x016b;ha </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhas&#x016b;caka </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;s&#x016b;caka</em> m. 'indicator of asterisms', an astrologer <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bh&#x0101;&#x1e43;&#x015b;a </dt>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhena </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x00ea;na</em> m. 'lord of stars', the sun or the moon <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhe&#x015b;a </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x00ea;&#x015b;a</em> m. the regent of an asterism &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>bha 5</dt>
           <dd><em>bha</em> m. (prob. onomat.) a bee <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>bha&#x1e43;sas </dt>
           <dd><em>bha&#x1e43;sas</em> n. a partic. part of the intestine or abdomen <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> (cf. <em>bhas&#x00e1;d</em>)</dd>

           <dt>bhakabhak&#x0101;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>bhakabhak&#x0101;ya</em> (onomat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>bheka</em>, a frog, and Gk. ?), Nom. &#x0100;. <em>&#x25cb;yate</em>, to croak <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Subh">Subh.</a> (cf. [742, 2] <em>bakabak&#x0101;ya</em>, <em>makamak&#x0101;ya</em>)</dd>

           <dt>bhakkik&#x0101; </dt>
           <dd><em>bhakkik&#x0101;</em> f. a cricket <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> (cf. <em>pha&#x1e0d;i&#x1e45;g&#x0101;</em>)</dd>

           <dt>bhakku&#x1e0d;a </dt>
           <dd><em>bhakku&#x1e0d;a</em> or <em>bhakkura</em> m. a species of fish <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a></dd>

           <dt>bhakta </dt>
           <dd><em>bhakta</em> <em>bhakti</em> &amp;c. p. 743</dd>

           <dt>bhak&#x1e63; </dt>
           <dd><em>bhak&#x1e63;</em> (prob. a secondary form fr. &#x221a;<em>bhaj</em>, or Nom. fr. <em>bhak&#x1e63;&#x00e1;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. also &#x221a;<em>bhik&#x1e63;</em> and <em>bha&#x00f1;j</em>), cl. 10. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxxii, 22) <em>bhak&#x1e63;&#x00e1;yati</em> (rarely &#x0100;. <em>&#x25cb;te</em>), and in later language also cl. 1. P. &#x0100;. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxi, 27) <em>bhakskati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (pf. <em>bhak&#x1e63;ay&#x0101;m &#x0101;sa</em> cf. MBh. &amp;c., fut. <em>bhak&#x1e63;ayi&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> cf. ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ababhak&#x1e63;at</em> cf. &#x015a;Br </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>abhak&#x1e63;i</em> cf. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bhak&#x1e63;ayitum</em> cf. MBh., <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;itum</em> cf. Pa&#x00f1;cat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>bhak&#x1e63;ayitv&#x0101;</em> cf. MBh </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhak&#x1e63;ya</em> cf. ib </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhak&#x1e63;am</em> cf. &#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r.), to eat or drink, devour, partake of (with acc., in Ved. also with gen </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in the older language usually of fluids, in the later only exceptionally so) cf. RV. &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to sting, bite cf. Kath&#x0101;s </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to consume, use up, waste, destroy cf. Mn. cf. MBh. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to drain the resources of, impoverish cf. K&#x0101;m.: Caus. <em>bhak&#x1e63;&#x00e1;yati</em>, above </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cause anything (acc.) to be eaten by (acc. or instr.) cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 52 cf. V&#x0101;rtt. 7 cf. Pat.: Desid. <em>bibhak&#x1e63;i&#x1e63;ati</em> or <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;ayi&#x1e63;ati</em>, to wish to eat or devour cf. MBh. cf. &#x0100;p&#x015a;r. cf. Sch. (cf. <em>bibhak&#x1e63;ayi&#x1e63;u</em>). <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p742-3"></a>[Page 742, Column 3]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhak&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>bhak&#x1e63;&#x00e1;</em> m. drinking or eating, drink or (in later language) food <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (often ifc., with f. <em>&#x0101;</em>, having anything for food or beverage, eating, drinking, living upon) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;ra</em> m. 'food-maker', a cook, baker <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-&#x1e43;-k&#x0101;r&#x00e1;</em> mfn. furnishing food <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrS">MaitrS.</a> (cf. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 6-3, 72 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#V&#x0101;rtt">V&#x0101;rtt.</a> 2 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pat">Pat.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-&#x1e43;k&#x1e5b;ta</em> (<em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;&#x00e1;&#x1e43;-</em>), mfn. drunk or eaten, enjoyed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r">&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-japa</em> m. the prayer muttered while drinking Soma <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r">&#x0100;&#x015b;v&#x015a;r.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-pattr&#x012b;</em> f. betel-pepper (the leaf of which serves for food) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-b&#x012b;ja</em> w&#x1e5b;. for <em>bhak&#x1e63;ya-b&#x25cb;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-mantra</em> m. a verse spoken while drinking Soma <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r">&#x015a;&#x0101;&#x1e45;kh&#x015a;r.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhak&#x1e63;aka </dt>
           <dd><em>bha&#x1e0d;k&#x1e63;aka</em> mfn. one who eats, an eater, enjoyer, one who feeds or lives upon (often ifc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; voracious, gluttonous, a gourmand <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. food <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hcat">Hcat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ik&#x0101;</em>), f. eating, chewing (cf. <em>ik&#x1e63;u-bh&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a meal, food (cf. <em>u&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ra-bh&#x25cb;</em>)</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhak&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a </dt>
           <dd><em>bha&#x1e0d;k&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;a</em> mfn. eating, one who eats (cf. <em>d&#x0101;&#x1e0d;ima-</em>, <em>p&#x0101;pa-bh&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the act of eating, drinking, feeding <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rS">&#x015a;rS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Nir">Nir.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; eating what excites thirst <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; chewing <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the being eaten by (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>bh&#x00e1;&#x25cb;</em>) a drinking vessel <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-t&#x0101;</em> f. eatableness <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP">&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>bha&#x1e0d;k&#x1e63;in</em> mfn. (mostly ifc </dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhak&#x1e63;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>bha&#x1e0d;k&#x1e63;ya</em> mfn. to be eaten, eatable, fit for food <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. anything eaten, food (esp. such as requires mastication) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. food, dish <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>, (prob. w&#x1e5b;. for <em>bhak&#x1e63;a</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-k&#x0101;ra</em>, <em>k&#x0101;raka</em> and <em>-&#x1e43;-k&#x0101;ra</em> m. a baker <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bija</em> m. Buchanania Latifolia <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhak&#x1e63;aka</em> m. du. food and the eater <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhojya-maya</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>)n. consisting of food of all kinds <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhojya-vih&#x0101;ra-vat</em> mfn. furnished with various kinds of food and places of refection <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-m&#x0101;ly&#x00e2;pa&#x1e47;a</em> m. a market where victuals and garlands are sold <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-vastu</em> n. edible matter, victuals, viands <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MW">MW.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;y&#x00e2;bhak&#x1e63;ya</em> n. what may and may not be eaten, food allowed and prohibited <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> v, 26 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;y&#x00e2;l&#x0101;bu</em> f. a variety of cucumber (= <em>r&#x0101;j&#x00e2;l&#x0101;bu</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhakt&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bhaktum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bhajya</em> and <em>-bh&#x0101;&#x0341;jam</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a>), to divide, distribute, allot or apportion to (dat. or gen.), share with (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (&#x0100;., rarely P.) to turn or resort to, engage in, assume (as a form), put on (garments), experience, incur, undergo, feel, go or fall into (with acc., esp. of abstract noun, e.g. <em>bh&#x012b;tim</em>, to feel terror </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to declare for, prefer, choose (e.g. as a servant) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to serve, honour, revere, love, adore <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c.: Caus. <em>bh&#x0101;j&#x00e1;yate</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (aor. <em>ab&#x012b;bhaju&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a>, <em>ababh&#x0101;jat</em> Gr.), to divide <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to put to flight, pursue, chase, drive into (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cook, dress (food) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a>: Desid. <em>bibhak&#x1e63;ati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> (cf. &#x221a;<em>bhik&#x1e63;</em>): Intens. <em>b&#x0101;bhajyate</em>, <em>b&#x0101;bhakti</em>, G&#x1e5b;.            <dd>&#x2022; N. of an &#x0100;ditya (bestowing wealth and presiding over love and marriage, brother of the Dawn, regent of the Nakshatra Uttara-Phalgun&#x012b; </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; according to a later legend his eyes were destroyed by Rudra) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p743-3"></a>[Page 743, Column 3]</font> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; the moon <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; good fortune, happiness, welfare, prosperity <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;">Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) dignity, majesty, distinction, excellence, beauty, loveliness <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;S">G&#x1e5b;S.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also n. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) love, affection, sexual passion, amorous pleasure, dalliance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r">K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (n. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. in <em>bhag&#x0101;-n&#x0101;mn&#x012b;</em> below </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. a partic. Muh&#x016b;rta <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;g&#x012b;t&#x0101;</em> f. pl. (sometimes with <em>upani&#x1e63;ad</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; once <em>&#x25cb;ta</em> n. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a>) 'K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a's song', N. of a celebrated mystical poem (interpolated in the <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> where it forms an episode of 18 chapters from vi, 830-1532, containing a dialogue between K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a and Arjuna, in which the Pantheism of the Ved&#x00e2;nta is combined with a tinge of the S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khya and the later principle of <em>bhakti</em> or devotion to K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a as the Supreme Being </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> IW. 122 &amp;c.) </dd>

(<em>&#x25cb;rya-candrik&#x0101;</em> f. <em>&#x25cb;rya-d&#x012b;pik&#x0101;</em> f. <em>&#x25cb;rya-nir&#x1e47;aya</em> m. <em>&#x25cb;rya-bodhik&#x0101;</em> f. <em>&#x25cb;rya-bodhin&#x012b;</em> f.), <em>-pratipada</em> n. <em>-prasth&#x0101;na</em> n. <em>-bodhaka</em> n. <em>-bh&#x0101;va-prak&#x0101;&#x015b;a</em> m. <em>-bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;ya</em>, n.            <dt>bhajeratha </dt>
           <dd><em>bhaj&#x00e9;ratha</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> x, 60, 2 (cf. Padap. <em>bhaje</em> + <em>aratha</em>), prob. <em>bhaj&#x00e9;</em> (inf.) or <em>bh&#x00e1;je</em> (1. sg. fr. &#x221a;<em>bhaj</em>) + <em>r&#x00e1;thasya</em></dd>

           <dt>bha&#x00f1;j 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bha&#x00f1;j</em> cl. 7. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxix, 16) <em>bhanakti</em> (pf. <em>babh&#x00e1;&#x00f1;ja</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c., 3. pl. &#x0100;. <em>babha&#x00f1;jire</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;&#x012b;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bha&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;yati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;kt&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>bha&#x1e45;ktv&#x0101;</em>, <em>bhaktv&#x0101;</em> or <em>-bhajya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>), to break, shatter, split <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to break into, make a breach in (a fortress, with acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to rout, put to flight, defeat (an army) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to dissolve (an assembly) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hcar">Hcar.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to break up i.e. divide (a S&#x016b;tra) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Siddh">Siddh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to bend <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to check, arrest, suspend, frustrate, disappoint <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c.: Pass. <em>bhajy&#x00e1;te</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;ji</em> or <em>abha&#x00f1;ji</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 6-4, 33), to be broken or break (intr.) &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>bha&#x00f1;jayati</em> (aor. <em>ababha&#x00f1;jat</em>), Gr.: Desid. <em>bibha&#x1e45;k&#x1e63;ati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>: Intens. <em>bambhajyate</em> or <em>&#x25cb;j&#x012b;ti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Perhaps for orig. <em>bhra&#x00f1;j</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>bhraj</em> ; Lat. <em>frangere</em>, <em>nau-fraga</em> ; Germ. <em>brechen</em> ; Eng. <em>break</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhagna </dt>
           <dd><em>bhagna</em> mfn. broken (lit. and fig.), shattered, split, torn, defeated, checked, frustrated, disturbed, disappointed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c. (sometimes forming the first instead of the second part of a comp., e.g. <em>gr&#x012b;v&#x0101;-bhagna</em>, <em>dharma-bh&#x25cb;</em> for <em>bhagna-gr&#x012b;va</em>, <em>-dharma</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; also 'one who has broken a limb' <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bent, curved <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lost <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> viii, 148 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. the fracture of a leg <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>bhadr&#x00e1;</em> mf(<em>&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>)n. blessed, auspicious, fortunate, prosperous, happy <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; voc. m. and f. sg. and pl. <em>bhadra</em>, <em>&#x25cb;dre</em>, <em>&#x25cb;dr&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, often in familiar address = my good sir or lady, my dear or my dears, good people <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x00e1;m</em> and <em>&#x00e1;y&#x0101;</em>, ind, happily, fortunately, joyfully <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;am</em> with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> or <em>&#x0101;-&#x221a;car</em>, to do well <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (prob.) a sanctimonious hypocrite <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> ix, 259 (v&#x1e37;. <em>&#x25cb;dra-pr&#x00ea;k&#x1e63;a&#x1e47;ikai&#x1e25;</em>) </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. a cow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of various plants (= <em>anant&#x0101;</em>, <em>aparij&#x0101;t&#x0101;</em>, <em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em>, <em>j&#x012b;vant&#x012b;</em>, <em>n&#x012b;l&#x012b;</em>, <em>r&#x0101;sn&#x0101;</em> &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p746-1"></a>[Page 746, Column 1]</font> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; of a daughter of &#x015a;ruta-k&#x012b;rti and wife of K&#x1e5b;ish&#x1e47;a cf. BhP </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of various rivers (esp. of one described as rising on the northern summit of Meru and flowing through Uttarakuru into the northern ocean) cf. Pur </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the celestial Ganges cf. L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a lake cf. Hcat </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. prosperity, happiness, health, welfare, good fortune (also pl.) cf. RV. &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>bhadra&#x1e43; tasya</em> or <em>tasmai</em>, prosperity to him! cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 2-3, 73 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhadra&#x1e43; te</em> or <em>va&#x1e25;</em> often used parenthetically in a sentence = 'if you please', or to fill up a verse </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhadram upal&#x0101;h</em>, happiness to you, O stones! &#x015a;&#x0101;nti&#x015b; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhadram</em> with &#x221a;<em>k&#x1e5b;</em> and dat., to grant welfare to, bless cf. RV.) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; gold cf. L </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; iron or steel cf. L </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a partic. part of a house cf. Nalac </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of various S&#x0101;mans cf. &#x0100;rshBr</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; raising the voice, shout or song of praise <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>

           <dt>bhava </dt>
           <dd><em>bhav&#x00e1;</em> m. (&#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>) coming info existence, birth, production, origin (= <em>bh&#x0101;va</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ifc., with f. <em>&#x0101;</em> = arising or produced from, being in, relating to) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;">Y&#x0101;j&#x00f1;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; becoming, turning into (comp.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h">K&#x0101;&#x1e6d;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; being, state of being, existence, life (= <em>sat-t&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP">&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP.</a> (cf. <em>bhav&#x00e2;ntara</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; worldly existence, the world (= <em>sa&#x1e43;s&#x0101;ra</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p749-1"></a>[Page 749, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with Buddhists) continuity of becoming (a link in the twelvefold chain of causation) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dharmas">Dharmas.</a> 42 (cf. MWB. 102) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; well-being, prosperity, welfare, excellence (= <em>&#x015b;reyas</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; obtaining, acquisition (= <em>&#x0101;pti</em>, <em>pr&#x00e2;pti</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a god, deity. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Agni <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of a deity attending on Rudra and frequently connected with &#x015a;arva (later N. of &#x015a;iva or a form of &#x015a;iva </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; or N. of a Rudra, and as such of the number 11 or of the 11th lunar mansion <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Gol">Gol.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; du. <em>bhavau</em> = Bhava i.e. &#x015a;iva and his wife Bhav&#x0101;n&#x012b; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> V&#x0101;m. v, 2, 1) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the 1st and 4th Kalpa <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x0101;</em>), f. = <em>bhavatat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 7-3, 45 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#V&#x0101;rtt">V&#x0101;rtt.</a> 3 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pat">Pat.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhavat </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x00e1;vat</em> mf(<em>ant&#x012b;</em>)n. being, present <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m.f, (nom. <em>bh&#x00e1;v&#x0101;n</em>, <em>&#x25cb;vat&#x012b;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; voc. <em>bhavan</em> or <em>bhos</em>, q.v </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; f. <em>&#x25cb;vati</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> Mn. ii, 49) your honour, your worship, your lordship or ladyship, you (lit. 'the gentleman or lady present' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>atra-</em> and <em>tatra-bh&#x25cb;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; used respectfully for the 2nd pers. pron., but properly with the 3rd and only exceptionally with the 2nd pers. of the verb, e.g. <em>bhav&#x0101;n dad&#x0101;tu</em>, 'let your highness give' </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes in pl. to express greater courtesy, e.g. <em>bhavanta&#x1e25; pram&#x0101;&#x1e47;am</em>, 'your honour is an authority') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>ant&#x012b;</em>), f. the present tense <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pat">Pat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>at&#x012b;</em>), f. a partic.kind of poisoned arrow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>bh&#x0101; 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;</em> cl. 2. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxiv, 43) <em>bh&#x0101;&#x0341;ti</em> (pr. p. <em>bh&#x0101;t</em> f. <em>bh&#x0101;nt&#x012b;</em> or <em>bh&#x0101;t&#x012b;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>bh&#x0101;y&#x0101;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pl. <em>babhau</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;s&#x012b;t</em> Gr. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bh&#x0101;sy&#x00e1;ti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c.), to shine, be bright or luminous <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to shine forth, appear, show one's self <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be splendid or beautiful or eminent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c. (with <em>na</em>, to cut a poor figure <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to appear as, seem, look like, pass for (nom. with or without <em>iva</em> adv. in <em>vat</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be, exist <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#W">W.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to show, exhibit, manifest <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> (v&#x1e37;.): Pass. <em>bh&#x0101;yate</em>, impers, radiance is put forth by (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a>: Caus. <em>bh&#x0101;payate</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ab&#x012b;bhapat</em> Gr.: Desid. <em>bibh&#x0101;sati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>: Intens. <em>b&#x0101;bh&#x0101;yate</em>, <em>b&#x0101;bheti</em>, <em>b&#x0101;bh&#x0101;ti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> [Cf. &#x221a;<em>bhan</em>, <em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;</em>, <em>bh&#x0101;s</em> ; Gk. ?            <dd>&#x2022; a fraction (often with an ordinal number, e.g. <em>a&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;amo bh&#x0101;ga&#x1e25;</em>, the eighth part, or in comp. with a cardinal, e.g. <em>&#x015b;ata-bh&#x25cb;</em> ; 1/100 </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>&#x015b;ata</em>, <em>vi&#x1e43;&#x015b;ati</em> &amp;c.) = <em>bh&#x0101;gika</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 5-1, 42 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; lucky, fortunate (compar. <em>-tara</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; n. sg. or pl. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) fate, destiny (resulting from merit or demerit in former existences), fortune, (esp.) good fortune, luck, happiness, welfare <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c. (<em>ena</em> ind. luckily, fortunately <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; reward <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a></dd>

           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;ra&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;a</em> m. N. of a fabulous bird <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;atr">&#x015a;atr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>&#x012b;</em>), f. the female of this bird <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a></dd>

           <dt>bh&#x0101;rata </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;&#x0341;rata</em> mf(<em>&#x012b;</em>)n. descended from Bharata or the Bharatas (applied to Agni either 'sprung from the priests called Bharatas or 'bearer of the oblation') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; belonging or relating to the Bharatas (with <em>yuddha</em> n. <em>sa&#x1e43;gr&#x0101;ma</em> m. <em>samara</em> m. <em>samiti</em> f. the war or battle of the Bh&#x1e6d;Bharatas </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with or scil, <em>&#x0101;khy&#x0101;na</em> n. with <em>itih&#x0101;sa</em> m. and <em>kath&#x0101;</em> f. the story of the Bharatas, the history or narrative of their war </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with or scil. <em>ma&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;ala</em> n. or <em>var&#x1e63;a</em> n. 'king Bh&#x1e6d;Bharatas's realm' i.e. India) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inhabiting Bharatas-varsha i.e. India <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. a descendant of Bharata (also in pl. for <em>bharat&#x0101;s</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p753-2"></a>[Page 753, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>a&#x015b;va-medha</em>), N. of the author of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> v, 27 </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; N. of &#x015a;ukra (regent of the planet Venus and preceptor of the Daityas) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> &amp;c </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; but also of many other writers or mythological personages, e.g. of ala, of &#x1e5a;ic&#x012b;ka, of Dvi-gat, of Dri&#x015b;&#x0101;na, of M&#x0101;rka&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;eya, of Pramati &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rS">&#x015a;rS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RAnukr">RAnukr.</a> </dd>

           <dt>bh&#x0101;va </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;v&#x00e1;</em> m. (&#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em>) becoming, being, existing, occurring, appearance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;vetUp">&#x015a;vetUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r">K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.</a> &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p754-2"></a>[Page 754, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; turning or transition into (loc. or comp.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RPr&#x0101;t">RPr&#x0101;t.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; continuance (opp. to cessation </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>ek&#x00f4;ti-bh&#x0101;va</em>, continuity of the thread of existence through successive births <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Buddh">Buddh.</a>, wrongly translated under <em>ek&#x00f4;ti-bh&#x25cb;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; state, condition, rank (with <em>sth&#x0101;vira</em>, old age </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>anyam bh&#x0101;vam &#x0101;padyate</em>, euphem. = he dies </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; state of being anything, esp. ifc., e.g. <em>b&#x0101;labh&#x0101;va</em>, the state of being a child, childhood = <em>b&#x0101;lat&#x0101;</em>, or <em>tva</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; sometimes added pleonastically to an abstract noun, e.g. <em>tanut&#x0101;-bh&#x0101;va</em>, the state of thinness) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;rS">&#x015a;rS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; true condition or state, truth, reality (ibc. and <em>bh&#x0101;vena</em> ind. really, truly) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; manner of being, nature, temperament, character (<em>eko bh&#x0101;va&#x1e25;</em> or <em>eka-bh&#x25cb;</em>, a simple or artless nature </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x0101;vo bh&#x0101;va&#x1e43; nigacchati</em> = birds of a feather flock together) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; manner of acting, conduct, behaviour <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; any state of mind or body, way of thinking or feeling, sentiment, opinion, disposition, intention (<em>y&#x0101;d&#x1e5b;&#x015b;ena bh&#x0101;vena</em>, with whatever disposition of mind </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x0101;vam ama&#x1e45;gala&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, with loc., to be ill disposed against </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x0101;va&#x1e43; d&#x1e5b;&#x1e0d;ha&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, to make a firm resolution) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in rhet.) passion, emotion (2 kinds of Bh&#x0101;vas are enumerated, the <em>sth&#x0101;yin</em> or primary, and <em>vyabhic&#x0101;rin</em> or subordinate </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the former are 8 or 9 according as the Rasas or sentiments are taken to be 8 or 9 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the latter 33 or 34) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prat&#x0101;p">Prat&#x0101;p.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; conjecture, supposition <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; purport, meaning, sense (<em>iti bh&#x0101;va&#x1e25;</em>, 'such is the sense' = <em>ity artha&#x1e25;</em> or <em>ity abhipr&#x00e2;ya&#x1e25;</em>, constantly used by commentators at the end of their explanations) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; love, affection, attachment (<em>bh&#x0101;va&#x1e43;-&#x221a;k&#x1e5b;</em>, with loc., to feel an affection for) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the seat of the feelings or affections, heart, soul, mind (<em>paritu&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;ena bh&#x0101;vena</em>, with a pleased mind) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;vetUp">&#x015a;vetUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; that which is or exists, thing or substance, being or living creature (<em>sarva-bh&#x0101;v&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, all earthly objects </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x0101;v&#x0101;&#x1e25; sth&#x0101;vara-ja&#x1e45;gam&#x0101;&#x1e25;</em>, plants and animals) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up">Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in dram.) a discreet or learned man (as a term of address = respected sir) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x1e5b;icch">M&#x1e5b;icch.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;lav">M&#x0101;lav.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m">M&#x0101;lat&#x012b;m.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in astron.) the state or condition of a planet <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an astrological house or lunar mansion <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the 27th Kalpa (s.v.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the 8th (42nd) year in Jupiter's cycle of 60 years <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (in gram.) the fundamental notion of the verb, the sense conveyed by the abstract noun (esp. as a term for an impersonal passive or neuter verb having neither agent nor object expressed, e.g. <em>pacyate</em>, 'there is cooking' or 'cooking is going on') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-1, 66 ; 107 &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the author of the Bh&#x0101;vapr&#x0101;ka&#x015b;a (= <em>mi&#x015b;ra-bh&#x0101;va</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wanton sport, dalliance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; birth <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; place of birth, the womb <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the world, universe <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an organ of sense <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; superhuman power <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the Supreme Being <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; advice, instruction <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; contemplation, meditation <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> (cf. <em>-samanvita</em>)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; manifesting, showing, Mallin </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; any work in the common or vernacular speech <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VPr&#x0101;t">VPr&#x0101;t.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;S">G&#x1e5b;S.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an explanatory work, exposition, explanation, commentary (esp. on technical S&#x016b;tras) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of Pata&#x00f1;jali's <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Comm">Comm.</a> on the S&#x016b;tras of P&#x0101;&#x1e47;ini (cf. <em>mah&#x0101;-bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;ya</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; of the 4th ch. of the <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhavP">BhavP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a sort of house or building <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;yak&#x0101;ra </dt>

           <dt>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63; 2</dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;</em> (&#x221a;<em>bha&#x1e63;</em>), occurring only in <em>rak&#x1e63;o-bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;a </dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e63;a</em> w&#x1e5b;. for <em>bh&#x0101;sa</em>, q.v</dd>

           <dt>bh&#x0101;s 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;s</em> cl. 1. &#x0100;. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xvi, 23) / <em>bh&#x0101;sate</em> (in older language also P. <em>bh&#x0101;&#x0341;sati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; p. <em>bh&#x0101;&#x0341;sat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>babh&#x0101;se</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;si&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bh&#x0101;si&#x1e63;yate</em>, <em>bh&#x0101;sit&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>), to shine, be bright <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to appear ('as' or 'like', nom. or instr. of an abstract noun), occur to the mind, be conceived or imagined become clear or evident <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Ved&#x00e2;ntas">Ved&#x00e2;ntas.</a> &amp;c.: Caus <em>bh&#x0101;sayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (aor. <em>ababh&#x0101;sat</em> and <em>ab&#x012b;bhasat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 7-4, 3), to make shine, illuminate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p756-1"></a>[Page 756, Column 1]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to show, make evident, cause to appear ('by way of.' instr. of an abstract noun) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Cat">Cat.</a>, Desid. <em>bibh&#x0101;si&#x1e63;ate</em> Gr.: Intens. <em>b&#x0101;bh&#x0101;syate</em>, <em>b&#x0101;bh&#x0101;sti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> (cf. &#x221a;<em>bh&#x0101;</em>, of which &#x221a;<em>bh&#x0101;s</em> is a secondary form)</dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bh&#x0101;s 2</dt>
           <dd><em>bh&#x0101;&#x0341;s</em> n. f. (cf. 2. <em>bh&#x0101;</em>) light or ray of light, lustre, brightness <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (<em>bh&#x0101;s&#x0101;&#x1e43; nidhi</em> [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prasa&#x1e45;g">Prasa&#x1e45;g.</a>] and <em>bh&#x0101;s&#x0101;m pati</em> {cf. Hcat.}, m. 'receptacle or lord of rays of light', the sun) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; an image, reflection shadow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MW">MW.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; glory, splendour, majesty <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; wish, desire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bh&#x0101;skara </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;kara</em> mfn. (also <em>bh&#x0101;&#x1e25;-kara</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 8-3, 46 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a>) 'making light', shining, glittering, bright <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhart&#x1e5b;">Bhart&#x1e5b;.</a> (v&#x1e37;. <em>bh&#x0101;sura</em> and <em>&#x25cb;svara</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; m. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) the sun <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#T&#x0100;r">T&#x0100;r.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of &#x015a;iva <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a hero <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; impression made on the mind, fancy <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MW">MW.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a bird of prey, vulture (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> = <em>&#x015b;akunta</em>, <em>kukku&#x1e6d;a</em>, <em>g&#x1e5b;dhra</em> &amp;c.)         <br>          <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AdbhBr">AdbhBr.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;past">&#x0100;past.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> &amp;c.            <dd>&#x2022; a cow-shed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dt>bhid 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bhid</em> cl. P.&#x0100;. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xix, 2) <em>bhin&#x00e1;tti</em>, <em>bhintte</em> (impf. 2. 3. sg. <em>&#x00e1;bhinat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Subj. <em>bhin'&#x0101;da&#x1e25;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>bindh&#x00ed;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>binddhi</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> [cf. <em>binddhi-lava&#x1e47;&#x0101;</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cl, 1. P. <em>bh&#x00e9;dati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pot. <em>bhideyam</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>bibh&#x00e9;da</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor, 2. 3. sg. <em>bh&#x00e9;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <em>abhaits&#x012b;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhitth&#x0101;s</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>bhits&#x012b;&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;a</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bhetsy&#x00e1;ti</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Cond. <em>abhetsyat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bhett&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bh&#x00e9;ttava&#x00ed;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhettum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>bhittv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em>, <em>-bhidya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c.), to split, cleave, break, cut or rend asunder, pierce, destroy <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c, </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to pass through (as a planet or, comet) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Var">Var.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to disperse (darkness) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;ak">&#x015a;ak.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to transgress, violate, (a compact or alliance) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to open, expand <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MaitrUp">MaitrUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Megh">Megh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to loosen, disentangle, dissolve <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to disturb, interrupt, stop <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to disclose, betray <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to disunite, set at variance <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to distinguish, discriminate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a>: Pass, <em>bhidy&#x00e1;te</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> aor. <em>abhedi</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>bibhide</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;lid">K&#x0101;lid.</a>), to be split or broken, burst (intrans.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be opened (as a closed hand, eyes &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to overflow (as water) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be loosened, become loose <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up">Mu&#x1e47;&#x1e0d;Up.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be stopped or interrupted <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be disclosed or betrayed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be changed or altered (in mind), be won over <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be disunited <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to keep aloof from (instr.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be distinguished, differ from (abl.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khyak">S&#x0101;&#x1e43;khyak.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c.: Caus. <em>bhedayati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em> (aor. <em>ab&#x012b;bhidat</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. also <em>bhid&#x0101;pana</em>), to cause to split or break &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to split, break, shatter, crush, destroy cf. MBh. cf. Hariv. cf. Hit </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to separate, divide ( <em>bhedita</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to disunite, set at variance, perplex, unsettle (in opinion), seduce, win over cf. MBh. cf. R.: Desid. <em>b&#x00ed;bhitsati</em>, <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to wish to break through or disperse or defeat cf. RV. cf. MBh. (cf., <em>bibhits&#x0101;</em>): Desid, of Caus., <em>bibhedayi&#x1e63;u</em>: Intens. <em>bebhid&#x012b;ti</em> or <em>bebhetti</em>, to cleave repeatedly cf. Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;. [Cf. Lat. <em>findo</em> ; Germ. <em>beissen</em> ; Eng. <em>bite</em>.] <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p757-1"></a>[Page 757, Column 1]</font>
</dd>

           <dt>bhuj 1</dt>
           <dd><em>bhuj</em> cl. 6. P. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxviii, 124) <em>bhuj&#x00e1;ti</em> (pf. <em>bubhoja</em> aor. <em>abhauk&#x1e63;&#x012b;t</em> fut. <em>bhok&#x1e63;yati</em> and <em>&#x25cb;kt&#x0101;</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; really only pr. stem, aor. <em>-&#x00e1;bubhoj&#x012b;s</em> and ind. p. <em>-bhujya</em> after <em>nir</em> and, <em>pari</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. also <em>bhujam</em> in <em>bhuja&#x1e43;-ga</em> and <em>bhuja&#x1e43;gama</em>), to bend, curve </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (?) to sweep (cf. 1. <em>bhuj&#x00ed;</em>) cf. RV.: Pass. <em>bhujyate</em>, to be bent down or disheartened cf. Hit. iv, 28. [Cf. Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>fugio</em> ; [759, 1] Goth. <em>biugan</em>, <em>baugjan</em> (?) ; Germ. <em>biogan</em>, <em>biegen</em> ; Angl. Sax. <em>b&#x00fa;gan</em> ; Eng. <em>bow</em>.]</dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhujbhugna </dt>
           <dd><em>&#x25cb;bhugna</em> mfn. bent, curved, crooked, distorted <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;">&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; furrowed (as the brows) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;vy&#x00e2;d">K&#x0101;vy&#x00e2;d.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; forced aside <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prab">Prab.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; bent down, cowed, disheartened <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; N. of the Sa&#x1e43;dhi of <em>o</em> and, <em>au</em> before nonlabial vowels <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RPr&#x0101;t">RPr&#x0101;t.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x22d9; bhujd&#x1e5b;&#x015b; </dt>

           <dd><em>&#x25cb;netra</em> mfn. accompanied by distortion of the eyes (as a fever) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhpr">Bhpr.</a></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhuj 2</dt>
           <dd><em>bhuj</em> <em>tri-bh&#x00fa;j</em></dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhuja </dt>
           <dd><em>bhuja</em> m. (ifc. f. <em>&#x0101;</em>) the arm <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c. (<em>bhujayor antaram</em>, the breast <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bhart&#x1e5b;">Bhart&#x1e5b;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; cf. <em>bhuj&#x00e2;ntara</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the hand <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 7-3, 61 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the trunk of an elephant <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> iii, 15736 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a branch, bough <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; a bending, curve, coil (of a serpent </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; comp. below) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the side of any geometrical figure <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r">K&#x0101;ty&#x015a;r.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the base of a triangle <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the base of a shadow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>

           <dt>bhuj 3</dt>
           <dd><em>bhuj</em> cl. P. &#x0100;. (cf. Dh&#x0101;tup. xxix, 17) <em>bhun&#x00e1;kti</em>, <em>bhu&#x1e45;kt&#x00e9;</em> (rarely cl. 6.            <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abhauk&#x1e63;&#x012b;t</em>, <em>abhnkta</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x00f3;jam</em>, <em>bh&#x00f3;jate</em>, <em>bhujema</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhokt&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bh&#x00f3;jase</em>, <em>bh&#x00fa;jam</em>, <em>bhuje</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>: <em>bhoktum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>bhuktv&#x0101;</em> or <em>bhu&#x1e45;ktv&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a>). to enjoy, use, possess, (esp.) enjoy a meal, eat, eat and drink, consume (mostly &#x0100; </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; in Ved. generally with instr., later with acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p759-3"></a>[Page 759, Column 3]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to enjoy (carnally) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;ihy&#x0101;s">G&#x1e5b;ihy&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; to suffer, experience, undergo, be requited or rewarded for (acc.) or at the hands of (gen.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (P.) to be of use or service to (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; (in astron.) to pass through, fulfil <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x016b;ryas">S&#x016b;ryas.</a>: Pass. <em>bhujyate</em> (aor. <em>abhoji</em>), to be enjoyed or eaten or possessed or made use of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c.: Caus. <em>bhojayati</em> (<em>te&#x25cb;</em>, m.c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-3, 87 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; once <em>bhu&#x00f1;j&#x0101;payati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> ii, 49, v. l </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ab&#x016b;bhujat</em>, <em>&#x25cb;jata</em> Gr.), to cause to enjoy or eat, feed with (two acc. or acc. of pers. and instr. of thing </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 1-4, 52) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to use as food <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Car">Car.</a>: Desid. <em>bubhuk&#x1e63;ati</em> (once), <em>&#x25cb;te</em>, to wish to eat, be hungry <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wish to enjoy or partake of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Naish">Naish.</a> (cf. <em>bubhuk&#x1e63;&#x0101;</em>, <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;ita</em>, <em>&#x25cb;k&#x1e63;u</em>): Intens. <em>bobhujyate</em>, to be eaten frequently <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#VarB&#x1e5b;S">VarB&#x1e5b;S.</a> </dd>

           <dt>&#x226b; bhuji&#x1e63;ya </dt>
           <dd><em>bhuji&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;</em> mfn. granting food, useful <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> (cf. <em>a-bh&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; free, independent <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#L">L.</a> </dd>

           <dd><em>bh&#x016b;</em> cl. 1. P. (<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> i, 1) <em>bh&#x00e1;vati</em> (rarely &#x0100;. <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; pf. <em>babh&#x016b;&#x0341;va</em>, 2. pers. <em>&#x25cb;&#x016b;&#x0341;tha</em> or <em>&#x25cb;&#x016b;vitha</em>, <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#cf">cf.</a> P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 7-2, 64 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>babh&#x016b;y&#x0101;s</em>, <em>&#x25cb;y&#x0101;&#x0341;r</em>, <em>babh&#x016b;tu</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. <em>babh&#x016b;ve</em> or <em>bubh&#x016b;ve</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#below">below.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>&#x00e1;bh&#x016b;t</em>, <em>&#x25cb;&#x016b;van</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Impv. <em>bodh&#x00ed;</em> [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x221a;">&#x221a;.</a><em>budh</em>], <em>bh&#x016b;tu</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. or impf. <em>&#x00e1;bhuvat</em>, <em>bh&#x00fa;vat</em>, <em>bhuv&#x0101;ni</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Prec. <em>bh&#x016b;y&#x0101;sam</em>, 2. 3. sg. <em>&#x25cb;y&#x0101;s</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> <font color="#FF0000" font size=-2><a name="p760-2"></a>[Page 760, Column 2]</font> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;y&#x0101;t</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;yi&#x1e63;&#x1e6d;h&#x0101;s</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhavi&#x1e63;&#x0101;t</em> [?] <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitBr">AitBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>abhavi&#x1e63;ta</em>, <em>bhavi&#x1e63;&#x012b;&#x1e63;ta</em>. Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bhavi&#x1e63;y&#x00e1;ti</em>, ep. also <em>&#x25cb;te</em> and 2. pl. <em>&#x25cb;&#x1e63;yadhvam</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhavit&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bhuv&#x00e9;</em>, <em>-bhv&#x00e9;</em>, <em>bh&#x016b;&#x1e63;&#x00e1;&#x1e47;i</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhavitum</em>, <em>&#x25cb;tos</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>bh&#x016b;tv&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;tvii&#x0341;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bh&#x016b;&#x0341;ya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>-bh&#x016b;&#x0341;yam</em>, <em>-bh&#x00e1;vam</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a>), to become, be (with nom, or adv. or indecl. words ending in <em>&#x012b;</em> or <em>&#x016b;</em>, cf. <em>k&#x1e5b;&#x1e63;&#x1e47;&#x012b;-&#x221a;bh&#x016b;</em> &amp;c.), arise, come into being, exist, be found, live, stay, abide, happen, occur <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (often used with participles and other verbal nouns to make periphrastical verbal forms </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with a fut. p. = to be going or about to, e.g. <em>anuvak&#x1e63;yan bhavati</em>, he is going to recite <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the fut. of &#x221a;<em>bh&#x016b;</em> with a pf. p. = a fut. pf., e.g. <em>k&#x1e5b;tav&#x0101;n bhavi&#x1e63;yasi</em>, you will have done <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the pf. P. <em>babh&#x016b;va</em> after the syllable <em>&#x0101;m</em> is put for the pf. of verbs of the 10. cl. &amp;c. [<a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x221a;1">&#x221a;1.</a> <em>as</em> and &#x221a;1. <em>k&#x1e5b;</em>] </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; the &#x0100;. appears in this meaning <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;i&#x015b;">&#x015a;i&#x015b;.</a> ix, 84 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kum">Kum.</a> xiv. 46 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; observe also <em>bhavati</em> with a fut. tense, it is possible that, e.g. <em>bhavati bhav&#x0101;n y&#x0101;jayi&#x1e63;yati</em>, it is possible that you will cause a sacrifice to be performed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 3-3, 146 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhavet</em>, may be, granted, admitted <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;&#x015b;">K&#x0101;&#x015b;.</a> on P. iii, 2. 114 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhavatu</em> id., well, good, enough of this <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hit">Hit.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>iticed bhavet</em>, if this question should be asked <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> x, 66 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>kva tad bhavati</em>, what is to become of this, it is quite useless <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TBr">TBr.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>na</em> = to cease to exist, perish, die <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>iha na</em>, not to be born on earth <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>&#x015b;ata-dh&#x0101;</em>, to fall into a hundred pieces <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>d&#x016b;rata&#x1e25;</em>, to keep aloof. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP">&#x015a;&#x0101;r&#x1e45;gP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>manasi</em> or <em>cetasi</em> and gen., to occur to the mind of any one <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;d">K&#x0101;d.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; id. with gen. alone <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Lalit">Lalit.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fall to the share or become the property of, belong to (cf. 'esse alicujus </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'with gen., rarely dat. or loc., accord. to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vop">Vop.</a> also with <em>pari</em> or <em>prati</em> and preceding acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be on the side of, assist (with gen. or <em>-tas</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> 1301 (cf. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 5-4, 48 <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to serve for, tend or conduce to (with dat. of thing) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c. (with <em>phal&#x0101;ya</em>. to bear fruit <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;m">K&#x0101;m.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be occupied with or engaged in, devote one's self to (with loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to thrive or prosper in (instr.), turn out well, succeed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to be of consequence or useful <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> iii, 181 </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also &#x0100;. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxxiv, 37) to fall, or get into, attain to, obtain <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>id&#x00e1;m</em>) to obtain it, i.e. be successful or fortunate <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a>: Pass. <em>bh&#x016b;yate</em> (or <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;vi</em>) sometimes used impers., e.g. <em>yair bhavi&#x1e63;yate</em>, by whom it will be existed, i.e. who will be <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a>: Caus. <em>bh&#x0101;vayati</em> (rarely <em>&#x25cb;te</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>ab&#x012b;bhavat</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bh&#x0101;vitum</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Pass. <em>bh&#x0101;vyate</em> &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>), to cause to be or become, call into existence or life, originate, produce, cause, create <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pur">Pur.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to cherish, foster, animate, enliven, refresh, encourage, promote, further <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AitUp">AitUp.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to addict or devote one's self to, practise (acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#HYog">HYog.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to subdue, control <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (also &#x0100;. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Dh&#x0101;tup">Dh&#x0101;tup.</a> xxxiv, 37) to obtain <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Jaim">Jaim.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Sch">Sch.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to manifest, exhibit, show, betray <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;m">K&#x0101;m.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Da&#x015b;">Da&#x015b;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to purify <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to present to the mind, think about, consider, know, recognize as or take for (two acc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to mingle, mix, saturate, soak, perfume <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kau&#x015b;">Kau&#x015b;.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Su&#x015b;r">Su&#x015b;r.</a> (cf. <em>bh&#x0101;vita</em>, p. 755, col. 1): Desid, of Caus. <em>bibh&#x0101;vayi&#x1e63;ati</em> (cf.            <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>k&#x1e63;ipram</em>), to strive to be quickly possessed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to want to get on, strive to prosper or succeed <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#TS">TS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Br">Br.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to want to have, care for, strive after, esteem, honour <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Hariv">Hariv.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to want to take revenge <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a>: Intens, <em>b&#x00f3;bhaviiti</em>, <em>bobhavati</em>, <em>bobhoti</em>, <em>bibh&#x016b;yate</em>, to be frequently, to be in the habit of <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#BhP">BhP.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; an element of life <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MW">MW.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x25cb;th&#x00e2;nubhava</em> m. the apprehension of any matter of fact <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;a&#x1e43;k">&#x015a;a&#x1e43;k.</a></dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; a territory, country, district <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;">&#x0100;&#x015b;vG&#x1e5b;.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;mn&#x0101;</em> ind. generally, usually <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;v">K&#x0101;v.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x016b;n&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> ind. plentifully, abundantly <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>) </dd>

           <dd><em>bh&#x016b;&#x0341;yas</em> mfn. becoming (n. the act of becoming </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>brahma-bh&#x25cb;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; 'becoming in a greater degree' (in this meaning accord. to <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#P&#x0101;&#x1e47;">P&#x0101;&#x1e47;.</a> 6-4, 158 compar. of <em>bahu</em>) i.e. more, more numerous or abundant, greater, larger, mightier (also 'much or many, very numerous or abundant' &amp;c.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; abounding in, abundantly furnished with (instr. or comp.). <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#S&#x0101;h">S&#x0101;h.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>as</em>), ind. (g. <em>svar-&#x0101;di</em>) more, most, very much, exceedingly <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; still more, moreover, besides, further on <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS">G&#x1e5b;&#x015a;rS.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Up">Up.</a> &amp;c. (also <em>bh&#x016b;yasy&#x0101; m&#x0101;tray&#x0101;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Divy&#x00e2;v">Divy&#x00e2;v.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>p&#x016b;rvam-bh&#x016b;ya&#x1e25;</em>, first-next <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>&#x0101;dau-pa&#x015b;c&#x0101;t-bh&#x016b;ya&#x1e25;</em>, first-then-next <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Prasa&#x1e45;g">Prasa&#x1e45;g.</a>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; once more, again, anew <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c. (also <em>bh&#x016b;yo'pi</em>, <em>bh&#x016b;ya&#x015b; c&#x00e2;pi</em>, <em>bh&#x016b;yo bh&#x016b;ya&#x1e25;</em> and <em>punar bh&#x016b;ya&#x1e25;</em>) </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (<em>as&#x0101;</em>), ind. exceedingly, in a high degree <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#K&#x0101;lid">K&#x0101;lid.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; mostly, generally, as a rule <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R">R.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Kath&#x0101;s">Kath&#x0101;s.</a> (cf. <em>yad bh&#x016b;yas&#x0101;</em>)</dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; <em>abh&#x1e5b;ta</em> Gr </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>abh&#x0101;r&#x1e63;am</em> Subj. <em>bhar&#x1e63;at</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>

           <dd>&#x2022; fut. <em>bhari&#x1e63;yati</em>, cond. <em>&#x00e1;bhari&#x1e63;yat</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bhart&#x0101;&#x0341;</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#&#x015a;Br">&#x015a;Br.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; inf. <em>bh&#x00e1;rtum</em>, <em>bh&#x00e1;rtave</em>, <em>bh&#x00e1;rtava&#x00ed;</em>, Ved </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; <em>bh&#x00e1;radhyai</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; ind. p. <em>-bhr4itya</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> &amp;c.), to bear, carry, convey, hold ('on' or, in', loc.) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to wear i.e. let grow (hair, beard, nails) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Mn">Mn.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to balance, hold in equipoise (as a pair of scales) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Vish&#x1e47;">Vish&#x1e47;.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to bear i.e. contain, possess, have, keep (also, keep in mind') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to support, maintain, cherish, foster <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to hire, pay <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to carry off or along (&#x0100;. <em>bharate</em>, 'for one's self' i.e. gain, obtain, or = <em>ferri</em> 'to be borne along') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#AV">AV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to bring, offer, procure, grant, bestow <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to endure, experience, suffer, under go <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to lift up, raise (the voice or a sound </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; &#x0100;. <em>bharate</em>, also 'to rise, be heard') <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to fill (the stomach) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Pa&#x00f1;cat">Pa&#x00f1;cat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>garbham</em>) to conceive, become pregnant (cf. under &#x221a;<em>dh&#x1e5b;</em>) <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; with <em>k&#x1e63;itim</em>) to take care of, rule, govern <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#R&#x0101;jat">R&#x0101;jat.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with, <em>&#x0101;j&#x00f1;&#x0101;m</em>) to submit to, obey <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#ib">ib.</a> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; (with <em>&#x016b;rj&#x0101;m</em>) to exert, employ <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;">Bha&#x1e6d;&#x1e6d;.</a>: Pass. <em>bhriy&#x00e1;te</em> (ep. also <em>&#x25cb;ti</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; aor. <em>abh&#x0101;ri</em>), to be borne &amp;c. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a> &amp;c. &amp;c.: Caus. <em>bh&#x0101;rayati</em> (aor. <em>ab&#x012b;bharat</em>), to cause to bear &amp;c </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; to engage for hire <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#MBh">MBh.</a>: Desid. <em>b&#x00fa;bh&#x016b;r&#x1e63;ati</em> (cf. &#x015a;Br. <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#M&#x0101;rkP">M&#x0101;rkP.</a>), <em>bibhari&#x1e63;ati</em> (cf. P&#x0101;&#x1e47;. 8-2, 49), to wish to bear or support or maintain: Intens. <em>b&#x00e1;ribharti</em> (3. pl. <em>&#x25cb;bhrati</em> <a href="worksAuthorsAbbrs.html#RV">RV.</a>, where also 2. du. <em>jarbh&#x1e5b;t&#x00e1;&#x1e25;</em>), <em>bar&#x012b;bharti</em> (cf. K&#x0101;v.), to bear repeatedly or continually, carry hither and thither' [Cf. Zd. <em>bar</em> </dd>
           <dd>&#x2022; Gk. ? ; Lat. <em>fero</em> ; Slav. <em>brati</em> ; Goth. <em>ba&#x00ed;ran</em> ; [764, 3] Germ. <em>beran</em>, <em>ge-b&#x0101;0ren</em> ; Eng. <em>bear</em>.]</dd>
